author: Janet Hook
title: Bipartisan Budget Deal Reveals Fissures for Both Parties
text:
WASHINGTONâ€”Passage of a two-year budget deal Friday was a rare feat of bipartisanship in Congress, but it exposed divisions within both the Democratic and Republican parties that will linger in legislative debates and midterm-election politics for months to come.
The budget deal, which jettisoned spending caps to increase defense and domestic spending over the next two years, infuriated antideficit crusaders and small-government activists who for years have been a key part of the GOP coalition.
...
